quizzes.question: Which of the following selects all elements with class="demo"?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Selectors[/h1]

Let's have a look at all jQuery selectors. 
As you have seen in the previous lesson, the jQuery selectors start with the [b]dollar sign[/b] and [b]parentheses[/b]: $().
The most basic selector is the element selector, which selects all the elements based on the element name. [code format="js" ]$("div")  // selects all <div> elements[/code]
Next are the id and class selectors, which select the elements by their id and class name: [code format="js" ]$("#test") // select the element with the id="test"
$(".menu") //selects all elements with class="menu"[/code]

quizzes.question:
Select all <a> links which are inside paragraph tags.
[!raw!]
{0}("{1}")
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Selectors [/h1] You can also use the following syntax for selectors: [code format="js" ]$("div.menu") // all
elements with class="menu" $("p:first") // the first

element $("h1, p") // all

and all

elements $("div p") // all

elements that are descendants of a

element $("*") // all elements of the DOM[/code] [note]Selectors make accessing HTML DOM elements easy compared to pure JavaScript.[/note]
